metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: jQuery - Dimensions
With jQuery, it is easy to work with the dimensions of elements and browser window.
content.html: With jQuery, it is easy to work with the dimensions of elements and browser window.

content.text: jQuery Dimension Methods
jQuery has several important methods for working with dimensions:
content.html: jQuery has several important methods for working with dimensions:

content.text: jQuery Dimensions
jQuery width() and height() Methods
The width() method sets or returns the width of an element (excludes padding, border and margin).
content.html: The width() method sets or returns the width of an element (excludes padding, border and margin).

content.text: The height() method sets or returns the height of an element (excludes padding, border and margin).
content.html: The height() method sets or returns the height of an element (excludes padding, border and margin).

content.text: The following example returns the width and height of a specified <div> element:
content.html: The following example returns the width and height of a specified <div> element:

content.code_html:
$("button").click(function(){
  var txt = "";
  txt += "Width: " + $("#div1").width() + "</br>";
  txt += "Height: " + $("#div1").height();
  $("#div1").html(txt);
});

content.text: jQuery innerWidth() and innerHeight() Methods
The innerWidth() method returns the width of an element (includes padding).
content.html: The innerWidth() method returns the width of an element (includes padding).

content.text: The innerHeight() method returns the height of an element (includes padding).
content.html: The innerHeight() method returns the height of an element (includes padding).

content.text: The following example returns the inner-width/height of a specified <div> element:
content.html: The following example returns the inner-width/height of a specified <div> element:

content.code_html:
$("button").click(function(){
  var txt = "";
  txt += "Inner width: " + $("#div1").innerWidth() + "</br>";
  txt += "Inner height: " + $("#div1").innerHeight();
  $("#div1").html(txt);
});

content.text: jQuery outerWidth() and outerHeight() Methods
The outerWidth() method returns the width of an element (includes padding and border).
content.html: The outerWidth() method returns the width of an element (includes padding and border).

content.text: The outerHeight() method returns the height of an element (includes padding and border).
content.html: The outerHeight() method returns the height of an element (includes padding and border).

content.text: The following example returns the outer-width/height of a specified <div> element:
content.html: The following example returns the outer-width/height of a specified <div> element:

content.code_html:
$("button").click(function(){
  var txt = "";
  txt += "Outer width: " + $("#div1").outerWidth() + "</br>";
  txt += "Outer height: " + $("#div1").outerHeight();
  $("#div1").html(txt);
});

content.text: The outerWidth(true) method returns the width of an element (includes padding, border, and margin).
content.html: The outerWidth(true) method returns the width of an element (includes padding, border, and margin).

content.text: The outerHeight(true) method returns the height of an element (includes padding, border, and margin).
content.html: The outerHeight(true) method returns the height of an element (includes padding, border, and margin).

content.code_html:
$("button").click(function(){
  var txt = "";
  txt += "Outer width (+margin): " + $("#div1").outerWidth(true) + "</br>";
  txt += "Outer height (+margin): " + $("#div1").outerHeight(true);
  $("#div1").html(txt);
});

content.text: jQuery More width() and height()
The following example returns the width and height of the document (the HTML document) and window (the browser viewport):
content.html: The following example returns the width and height of the document (the HTML document) and window (the browser viewport):

content.code_html:
$("button").click(function(){
  var txt = "";
  txt += "Document width/height: " + $(document).width();
  txt += "x" + $(document).height() + "\n";
  txt += "Window width/height: " + $(window).width();
  txt += "x" + $(window).height();
  alert(txt);
});

content.text: The following example sets the width and height of a specified <div> element:
content.html: The following example sets the width and height of a specified <div> element:

content.code_html:
$("button").click(function(){
  $("#div1").width(500).height(500);
});

content.text: jQuery Exercises
Test Yourself With Exercises
Exercise:
Use jQuery methods to set the height and width of <div> to 500 pixels.
content.html: Use jQuery methods to set the height and width of <div> to 500 pixels.

content.code_html: $("div").().();

content.text: Start the Exercise
jQuery CSS Reference
For a complete overview of all jQuery CSS methods, please go to our jQuery HTML/CSS Reference .
content.html: For a complete overview of all jQuery CSS methods, please go to our jQuery HTML/CSS Reference.
